ballSim
Class Ball

java.lang.Object
  ballSim.Ball

public class Ball
extends java.lang.Object

Ball represents a physical ball with a graphical representation. The ball itself determines how it moves in response to external forces acting on it. Movement is made by repeated calls to the move() method.

Version:
2 (04/11/2010) Based on a simple implementation of a Ball object written by Bruce Quig, Michael Kolling (mik) and David J. Barnes, for the book 'Objects First with Java - A practical Introduction Using BlueJ' (23-Jan-2002).
Author:
Robin Smith

Constructor Detail

Ball

public Ball(double xPos,
            double yPos,
            double xVel,
            double yVel,
            IntSimParameter diameter,
            DoubleParameter gravity,
            DoubleParameter ballHyst,
            DoubleParameter airRes,
            DoubleParameter rollRes,
            DoubleParameter rightWind,
            Canvas canvas,
            int[] platformPos,
            DataAnalyser data)
Constructor for BouncingBall object.

Parameters:
xPos - initial horizontal position of the ball.
yPos - initial vertical position of the ball.
xVel - initial horizontal speed of the ball.
yVel - initial vertical speed of the ball.
diameter - IntParameter for the diameter of the ball.
ballHyst - DoubleParameter for the ball's bouncing hysteresis.
airRes - DoubleParameter for external air resistance.
rollRes - DoubleParameter for surface rolling friction.
rightWind - DoubleParameter for the strength of East-blowing wind.
canvas - canvas for this Ball to be drawn on.
platformPos - int array of platform heights in the simulation as a function of x-coordinate in the simulation.
data - DataAnalyser object to send data to.
